sentence.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, a major transcription factor in transforming growth factor-β (TGF-β) signaling, plays critical roles in both tumor-suppressive and pro-oncogenic functions.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: However, recent discoveries of negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II-interacting molecules that preferentially bind phosphorylated Smad3 linker serine/threonine residues have shown a multitude of signal transductions that either enhance or suppress TGF-β responses associated with Smad3 turnover or cancer progression.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
